question: Which of the following statements about lipids and lipoproteins is true?
options: Lipids are characterized by being water-soluble and insoluble in nonpolar solvents.
Lipoproteins are simple particles consisting of lipids only.
Triglycerides are the form in which fatty acids are stored in the body and transported in the plasma.
Phospholipids do not participate in chemical reactions in the body.
answer: Triglycerides are the form in which fatty acids are stored in the body and transported in the plasma.
